revisionDesc.change: changed resp on editorial note to rmb from unk and updated profileDesc accordingly
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof

Corrections of names according to Eagle article, annotations for Eagle article names on Long Island Train disaster including old Dikeman; George Van Nostrand, Mrs. Steares, letter date, O'Connors, Philadelphia Bulletin, and "aftern." Bucke hand.
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)
Annotate reference to the Brooklyn Eagle
Encode regularization of contractions, days of week, and frequently misspelled words

body.p:
i got you to daytoday with the envelovesenvelopes and money all safe and sound waltWalt what made you think that was maryMarys Mary's georgeGeorge i knew when i first saw it that it wasent wasn't him he is not on the road he lives to meridan near springfieldSpringfield this young man that was killed was buried at Jamaca Jamaica there has been a full account of it in the eagle the Dr pray and his mother that was killed the mother was old judge dikemans Dikeman's daughter and the rushmores Rushmore's wife is sister to mrsMrs. pray likewise dikemans Dikeman's daughter she was not on the car it was the northportNorthport train Charlick the manager or owawer it was awful to read) well waltWalt last saturdaySaturday i had one of heyds Heyde's awful letters
if possible the worst one yet over two sheets of paper dont don't you think i had a good time reading it) well i got his in the forenoon and i got one from han in the afternafternoon if i hadent hadn't got hers i should have felt very bad i will sent the letter to you the next time i write i want georgeGeorge to read it before i send it i wont won't tell any thing she writes i dont don't mean to send mrMr. Heydes although he mentions your name not the most polite you have ever had it mentioned i wrote han a letter right away that we should expect her as soon as we got a little settled
i hope he wont won't keep it as he did yours) i had a letter from matt they have got a house and the two girls to work matt says if she was only rid of her coughf cough she should be real happy she said she would have sent me some change but they were dead broke i dont don't think its much use to get a high salary)

walt this is great writin writing but i have had to work so hard that my hands is so trembly and stiff i cant can't write maybee maybe you can make it out the germanGerman woman that i expected to have to help me about moving has took it on her head to get married about the 1 of may so i had to doo do more than i could hardly get
along with georgeGeorge is to camden Camden but will come home wensday Wednesday or thursday Thursday night the house aint ain't done but we shall have to move on saturday Saturday your next letter you must direct portland avePortland Ave.) i beleivebelieve the number is 71 opposite the Arsenal at any rate our old letter man has that route i think mrsMrs. steers is very clever does all she can to accomadateaccommodate but the people is coming in thursday Thursday evening i have given up the parlor and all i can but the only comfort i have that i shant have to move again very soon any how but strange things happen in these days dont don't they Walt so its best not to make any calcalationcalculation

closer.salute: good bie walterWalter my love as usual to the OconorsO'Connors

postscript.p: this compliment georgeGeorge cut out of the philadelpha Philadelphia bulletin
